content:
Is it possible to specify a branch for the git repo used in the index attribute of a registry config? If so, how?

I see I can do something like this:

[registries.example]
index = "https://git.example.com"

Can I provide a branch to use instead of the default for the repo?
Maybe with appending ?branch=foo too the url? That is how Cargo.lock encodes branches for git dependencies. It may or may not work for the registry url too.
I haven't tried but I would assume that regex = { git = "https://github.com/rust-lang/regex", branch = "next" } would work?
That is not using a cargo registry.
Ah sorry, I read the original question a bit to fast :)

Fredrik Park said:

I haven't tried but I would assume that regex = { git = "https://github.com/rust-lang/regex", branch = "next" } would work?

I think this is not currently possible: https://github.com/rust-lang/cargo/pull/9466
